tools.description:
Creates a new document that app can write to. And user can select where they'd like to create it.

Instead of selecting from existing PDF documents, 
the ACTION_CREATE_DOCUMENT lets users select where they'd like to create a new document, such as within another app that manages the document's storage. 
And then return the URI location of document that you can read from and write to.

mime_type.description: The MIME type of the document to be created (e.g., 'text/plain', 'application/pdf').

initial_name.description: The suggested name for the new document.

returns.description: A URI as a string pointing to the newly created document. URI name can be inferred from user query

examples:
# Create a new text document
new_doc_uri = ACTION_CREATE_DOCUMENT(mime_type='text/plain', initial_name='New Document.txt')

# Create a new PDF file
new_pdf_uri = ACTION_CREATE_DOCUMENT(mime_type='application/pdf', initial_name='Report.pdf')

# Create a new image file
new_image_uri = ACTION_CREATE_DOCUMENT(mime_type='image/jpeg', initial_name='Photo.jpg')

the ACTION_CREATE_DOCUMENT lets users select where they'd like to create a new document, such as within another app that manages the document's storage. 
And then return the URI location of document that you can read from and write to.

mime_type.description: The MIME type of the document to be created (e.g., 'text/plain', 'application/pdf').

initial_name.description: The suggested name for the new document.

returns.description: A URI as a string pointing to the newly created document. URI name can be inferred from user query

examples:
# Create a new text document
new_doc_uri = ACTION_CREATE_DOCUMENT(mime_type='text/plain', initial_name='New Document.txt')

# Create a new PDF file
new_pdf_uri = ACTION_CREATE_DOCUMENT(mime_type='application/pdf', initial_name='Report.pdf')

# Create a new image file
new_image_uri = ACTION_CREATE_DOCUMENT(mime_type='image/jpeg', initial_name='Photo.jpg')

query: Can you update my contact details for John? His record is at content://contacts/people/john and please set his phone number to 123-456-7890.
Please modify the contact at URI content://contacts/people/jane. I want to update her email to jane.doe@example.com and set her address as '123 Main St, New York'.
I need to update my business partner's details. The contact can be found at content://contacts/people/partner. Please change the company field to Acme Corp.
Can you modify the contact entry at content://contacts/people/alice? I'd like to update her name to 'Alice Smith'.
Please update the contact with URI content://contacts/people/bob. Change his phone to 555-1234 and set his company to 'Tech Innovations'.
Could you change the contact details at content://contacts/people/carla? I need to set her email to carla@example.com.
Patch the details for the contact located at content://contacts/people/kyle: update his address to '456 Elm St, Springfield'.
Please update the record at contact URI content://contacts/people/charlie by adding his new email (charlie@company.com) and phone number 9876543210.
I need to edit the contact at content://contacts/people/denise. Kindly update her company to Global Inc.
Hey, update my friend Eli's contact details at content://contacts/people/eli by setting his email to eli@domain.org.
Please change the details for the contact at content://contacts/people/frank. I want his address updated to '789 Broadway, NY' and his name corrected to 'Frank L.'.
I need to update one of my contacts at content://contacts/people/grace. Could you modify her phone number to 321-654-0987?
Please edit my colleague's information in the address book using URI content://contacts/people/harry. Update his email to harry@workplace.com and change his company to Big Tech.
Kindly update the details for the contact at content://contacts/people/ivy by changing her name to 'Ivy Green'.
I want to modify the contact available at content://contacts/people/jack. Please set his phone number to 202-555-0198 and update his address to '101 First Ave, San Francisco'.
Kindly update the details for the contact at content://contacts/people/john by setting his name to 'John Doe'.

tools.description:
Edit an existing contact.

This function allows the user to edit the details of a specific contact
based on the provided contact URI. Additional contact information can be
provided to pre-fill certain fields in the edit form.
Note: 
    The contact_uri can be obtained in two primary ways: 
    1. Using the contact URI returned by the ACTION_PICK function.
    2. Accessing the list of all contacts directly (requires appropriate permissions).

contact_uri.description: A content URI as a string, pointing to the contact to be edited. This URI can be obtained from the ACTION_PICK function or by querying the contacts database.

contact_info.description: A dictionary containing additional contact information to pre-fill in the edit form. Keys should correspond to contact fields (available key:  'email', 'phone', 'name', 'company', 'address'), and values should be the data to pre-fill. Default is None.

examples:
# Update Minji's phone number to 010-9876-5432 using contact_uri content://contacts/people/minji
contact_uri=ACTION_EDIT_CONTACT(contact_uri='content://contacts/people/minji', contact_info={'phone': '010-9876-5432'})

# Update Danielâ€™s company to samsung and email to daniel@samsung.com using contact_uri content://contacts/people/daniel
contact_uri=ACTION_EDIT_CONTACT(contact_uri='content://contacts/people/daniel', contact_info={'company': 'samsung', 'email': 'daniel@samsung.com'})

returns.description: A URI as a string pointing to the edited contact, or null if the edit was cancelled.

contact_uri=ACTION_EDIT_CONTACT(contact_uri='content://contacts/people/minji', contact_info={'phone': '010-9876-5432'})

# Update Danielâ€™s company to samsung and email to daniel@samsung.com using contact_uri content://contacts/people/daniel
contact_uri=ACTION_EDIT_CONTACT(contact_uri='content://contacts/people/daniel', contact_info={'company': 'samsung', 'email': 'daniel@samsung.com'})

returns.description: A URI as a string pointing to the edited contact, or null if the edit was cancelled.

query: Kindly update the contact at content://contacts/people/rachel with a new email: rachel@domain.net.

tools.description:
Edit an existing contact.

This function allows the user to edit the details of a specific contact
based on the provided contact URI. Additional contact information can be
provided to pre-fill certain fields in the edit form.
Note: 
    The contact_uri can be obtained in two primary ways: 
    1. Using the contact URI returned by the ACTION_PICK function.
    2. Accessing the list of all contacts directly (requires appropriate permissions).

contact_uri.description: A content URI as a string, pointing to the contact to be edited. This URI can be obtained from the ACTION_PICK function or by querying the contacts database.

contact_info.description: A dictionary containing additional contact information to pre-fill in the edit form. Keys should correspond to contact fields (available key:  'email', 'phone', 'name', 'company', 'address'), and values should be the data to pre-fill. Default is None.

examples:
# Update Minji's phone number to 010-9876-5432 using contact_uri content://contacts/people/minji
contact_uri=ACTION_EDIT_CONTACT(contact_uri='content://contacts/people/minji', contact_info={'phone': '010-9876-5432'})

# Update Danielâ€™s company to samsung and email to daniel@samsung.com using contact_uri content://contacts/people/daniel
contact_uri=ACTION_EDIT_CONTACT(contact_uri='content://contacts/people/daniel', contact_info={'company': 'samsung', 'email': 'daniel@samsung.com'})

returns.description: A URI as a string pointing to the edited contact, or null if the edit was cancelled.

tools.description:
Edit an existing contact.

This function allows the user to edit the details of a specific contact
based on the provided contact URI. Additional contact information can be
provided to pre-fill certain fields in the edit form.
Note: 
    The contact_uri can be obtained in two primary ways: 
    1. Using the contact URI returned by the ACTION_PICK function.
    2. Accessing the list of all contacts directly (requires appropriate permissions).

contact_uri.description: A content URI as a string, pointing to the contact to be edited. This URI can be obtained from the ACTION_PICK function or by querying the contacts database.

contact_info.description: A dictionary containing additional contact information to pre-fill in the edit form. Keys should correspond to contact fields (available key:  'email', 'phone', 'name', 'company', 'address'), and values should be the data to pre-fill. Default is None.

query: I need to open a PDF document for editing. Can you help me select one?
Please let me pick a plain text file from my device.
Open a file with an image format so that I can work on it.
I would like to choose several documents available in either PDF or plain text format. Let me select more than one at a time.
Can you open an image file for me? I'm looking for persistent access to it.
Help me open a document that's in PDF format for long-term editing.
Allow me to browse and select a PDF file from my files.
I need to select documents in both text and PDF formats. I plan to pick more than one file; please enable multiple selections.
I'm looking for image files to attach to my report. Could you let me choose multiple images?
Find me an external document that is a plain text file.
I want to launch a file picker to select a PDF document from my cloud storage.
Open the file chooser for image documents, and allow me to pick multiple files if necessary.
I need a document viewer to pick a plain text file â€“ please open the file dialog for text documents.
Please open documents of type PDF and text. I would like the option to select more than one file.
From my device, I want to open a single image file for persistent use.
Help me open a PDF file I can edit long-term.

tools.description: Allows the user to select one or multiple documents of specified MIME types from local storage, cloud services, or external document providers. This action provides long-term persistent access to the selected documents, making it ideal for use-cases such as file management applications, editors, or cloud-synced apps where continuous access to the files is necessary.

mime_types.description: A list of MIME type(s) for the document(s) to select. Accepts multiple MIME types (e.g., ["application/pdf", "text/plain"]).

allow_multiple.description: Allows selection of multiple documents if set to True. Defaults to False.

returns.description: A list of persistent content URIs as strings, each pointing to the selected document. Returns an empty list if no document is selected or the operation is canceled.

examples:
# Select a single image document for long-term editing
image_uris = ACTION_OPEN_DOCUMENT(["image/*"])

# Select multiple types of documents for persistent management
doc_uris = ACTION_OPEN_DOCUMENT(["application/pdf", "text/plain"], allow_multiple=True)

tools.description: Allows the user to select one or multiple documents of specified MIME types from local storage, cloud services, or external document providers. This action provides long-term persistent access to the selected documents, making it ideal for use-cases such as file management applications, editors, or cloud-synced apps where continuous access to the files is necessary.

mime_types.description: A list of MIME type(s) for the document(s) to select. Accepts multiple MIME types (e.g., ["application/pdf", "text/plain"]).

allow_multiple.description: Allows selection of multiple documents if set to True. Defaults to False.

returns.description: A list of persistent content URIs as strings, each pointing to the selected document. Returns an empty list if no document is selected or the operation is canceled.

examples:
# Select a single image document for long-term editing
image_uris = ACTION_OPEN_DOCUMENT(["image/*"])

# Select multiple types of documents for persistent management
doc_uris = ACTION_OPEN_DOCUMENT(["application/pdf", "text/plain"], allow_multiple=True)

tools.description: Allows the user to quickly select one or multiple existing files of a specified MIME type from local storage. This action is intended for temporary and immediate use-cases, such as attaching files to messages, emails, or quickly accessing images and videos. It returns temporary access (non-persistent) URIs to the selected files, suitable for short-term or one-time usage.

mime_type.description: The MIME type of the file(s) to select (e.g., "image/*", "audio/*", "video/*", "*/*").

allow_multiple.description: Allows the user to select multiple files if set to True. Defaults to False.

returns.description: A list of temporary content URIs as strings, each pointing to the selected file. Returns an empty list if no file is selected or the operation is canceled.

examples:
# Quickly select a single image for immediate use
image_uris = ACTION_GET_CONTENT("image/*")

# Quickly select multiple PDFs for immediate sharing
doc_uris = ACTION_GET_CONTENT("application/pdf", allow_multiple=True)

query: I'm attaching documents to an email; let me choose a few PDFs.

tools.description: Allows the user to quickly select one or multiple existing files of a specified MIME type from local storage. This action is intended for temporary and immediate use-cases, such as attaching files to messages, emails, or quickly accessing images and videos. It returns temporary access (non-persistent) URIs to the selected files, suitable for short-term or one-time usage.

mime_type.description: The MIME type of the file(s) to select (e.g., "image/*", "audio/*", "video/*", "*/*").

allow_multiple.description: Allows the user to select multiple files if set to True. Defaults to False.

returns.description: A list of temporary content URIs as strings, each pointing to the selected file. Returns an empty list if no file is selected or the operation is canceled.

query: Please open the PDF file located at content://documents/report.pdf.
Could you display this image for me at content://gallery/pic01.jpg?
I'd like to listen to the audio clip stored at content://media/audio/song.mp3.
Open the video available at content://videos/movie.mp4, please.
Show me the text document at content://docs/meeting_notes.txt.
I need to open the file at content://files/image.png.
Access this ebook for me: content://ebooks/novel.epub so I can read it.
Can you open content://downloads/archive.zip quickly?
Display the media file found at content://media/video_clip.avi on my screen.
I want to see the website snapshot stored at content://screenshots/webpage.jpeg.
Please load my notes from content://notes/todo.md.
Could you open the presentation file at content://attachments/presentation.pptx?
I have a sound file at content://audio/alarm.ogg, please open it.
Fetch and open the spreadsheet located at content://files/spreadsheet.xlsx.
Open the user manual from content://docs/user_manual.pdf without any delay.
Try opening the memo file at content://notes/memo.md.

tools.description: Opens or displays the content specified by a given URI directly. This action enables immediate viewing or opening of documents, images, videos, audio files, and other supported content types without showing any picker UI. Intended for scenarios where the content URI is already known or obtained from a prior selection.

uri.description: The content URI pointing to the content to open.

mime_type.description: The MIME type of the content (optional, used for context or verification).

returns.description: A URI as a string pointing to the content that was opened, or null if opening failed.

examples:
# Open a document URI
ACTION_OPEN_CONTENT(document_uri)

# Open an image URI
ACTION_OPEN_CONTENT(image_uri)

query: I need to select a ringtone for my alarm. Could you open the ringtone picker?
Please let me choose a ringtone. I want to set an alarm with my preferred sound.
Open the ringtone chooser so I can pick my alarm tone.
Could you trigger the ringtone selection process? I need to pick one for my alarm clock.
I want to customize my alarm. Open the ringtone picker for me.
Help me select a custom ringtone to use for my alarm. Please open the ringtone chooser.
I'm looking to change my alarm sound. Can you let me pick a ringtone from my device?
Let me choose a ringtone for my morning alarm by opening the device's ringtone picker.
Could you activate the ringtone selection tool so that I can set my alarm tone?
I would like to pick a new ringtone for my alarm. Open the ringtone selection interface, please.
Start the ringtone picker for me. I need to choose a sound for my alarm.
I want to select a sound for my alarm clock. Can you bring up my phone's ringtone chooser?
Trigger the device's ringtone picker so I can select a tune for my alarm.
Please open the ringtone picker. I want to choose the ringtone for my alarm setting.
I'm updating my alarm settings. Let me choose a ringtone by opening the ringtone selection tool.
I need to pick a new alarm tone. Can you launch the ringtone selection tool?

tools.description:
Let user select a ringtone and return the URI of the selected ringtone.

This function allows the user to select a ringtone from the device's ringtone picker.
It returns the content URI of the selected ringtone that can be use to set alarm.

returns.description: A content URI as a string for the chosen ringtone. keep in mind that ringtone was already chosen by the user.

examples:
# Let the user pick a ringtone
ringtone_uri = ACTION_GET_RINGTONE()

query: Take a photo with the camera app using the default settings; let the system choose where to save it.
Can you capture an image and store it at content://myapp/images/123?
I need to snap a picture. Please open my phone's camera app and capture the image with the usual settings.
Open the camera and save the photo at content://photos/storage.
Snap a picture for me using my device camera, letting the system decide the file location.
Capture a new image and save it under content://device/mypics/newimage, please.
I want to take a quick picture. Use the camera and choose the default storage location.
Could you quickly snap a pic and have it saved at content://user/data/pic1?
Using the phone's camera, record an image and let the system determine the save path.
Please trigger the camera to take a photo and save it to content://custom/path/photo.jpg.
Can you take a snapshot and store it at content://app/images/date2023?
Hey, would you capture an image using the camera app?
Show me how to take a photo and optionally save it to content://myphotos/location.
Take a picture using the camera, but don't worry about choosing a specific save path.
Trigger the camera and capture an image, storing it at content://alpha/beta/sample for later use.
Capture an image with default settings without specifying any storage location.

tools.description:
Capture a picture using the camera app and return the URI of the saved photo.

This function uses the ACTION_IMAGE_CAPTURE intent to open the camera app and capture a photo.
The photo is saved to a URI location, which is returned by this function.
User can optionally specify a filename or save location via the content URI parameters.

file_uri.description: A content URI indicating where to save the captured image (optional). If not provided, the camera app will choose a location.

returns.description: A content URI as a string pointing to the captured image. Returns None if the capture is canceled or fails.

examples:
# Capture an image and let the system decide the save location
photo_uri = ACTION_IMAGE_CAPTURE()

# Capture an image and specify the save location
photo_uri = ACTION_IMAGE_CAPTURE()

This function uses the ACTION_IMAGE_CAPTURE intent to open the camera app and capture a photo.
The photo is saved to a URI location, which is returned by this function.
User can optionally specify a filename or save location via the content URI parameters.

file_uri.description: A content URI indicating where to save the captured image (optional). If not provided, the camera app will choose a location.

returns.description: A content URI as a string pointing to the captured image. Returns None if the capture is canceled or fails.

examples:
# Capture an image and let the system decide the save location
photo_uri = ACTION_IMAGE_CAPTURE()

# Capture an image and specify the save location
photo_uri = ACTION_IMAGE_CAPTURE()

query: Capture an image with the camera and direct it to content://mystorage/new_pic.

query: Could you add a new contact for me? I need to store Alice Smith's details; her phone number is 555-1234.
Please insert a contact entry with the name Michael Johnson and his email michael@example.com.
I want to add a contact for Samuel Green. His details are: name 'Samuel Green', phone '555-6789', email 'samuel.green@mail.com', and address '456 Elm Street'.
Please add a new contact for Emily Brown. I have her phone number as 777-8888 and her address is 123 Maple Ave.
Could you add my friend Lucas to my contacts? His phone number is 123-456-7890.
I need to create a contact for Nina Patel with her email address nina.patel@example.com.
Kindly insert a contact for Mr. Robert King. His phone is 999-9999 and his email is robert.king@domain.com.
Please set up a new contact for Sarah Williams. Include her email (sarahw@site.com) and address (789 Broad Street).
Add a new contact entry for Carlos. His phone number is 321-654-0987.
Insert a contact: Diana Prince. Please add her email diana@themyscira.com.
I want to save the contact info of Jessica Drew. Her cell number is 112-233-4455 and her office address is listed as '1st Floor, Midtown Office'.
Could you create a contact for Bruce Wayne with the following details: phone number 777-7777, email bruce@wayneenterprises.com, and address '1007 Mountain Drive'?
I need to register a contact for Tony Stark. His details are: name Tony Stark, phone number 222-3333, and email ironman@starkindustries.com.
Please add a contact for Peter Parker. I have his phone as 555-0001, email peter.parker@dailybugle.com, and address '20 Ingram Street'.
Add a new entry for Bruce Banner. His information includes his name and email: bigguy@avengers.org.
Please add a contact: Emily Johnson. Her phone is 123-4567.

tools.description:
Insert a new contact.

This function allows the user to create a new contact with the provided
contact information. It will open the contact creation interface with
pre-filled information based on the provided data.

contact_info.description: A dictionary containing the contact details to insert. Possible keys include 'name', 'phone', 'email', 'address', etc.

returns.description: A content URI as a string pointing to the newly created contact. Returns None if the operation is canceled or fails.

examples:
# Insert a new contact with name and phone number
new_contact_uri = ACTION_INSERT_CONTACT({"name":  "John Doe", "phone":  "123-456-7890"})

query: Could you create a new contact for Michael Brown? I'd like his email as michael.brown@gmail.com and his address as Gold Street.

tools.description: Add a new event to the user's calendar.

BEGIN_TIME.description: The start time of the event in milliseconds since epoch.

END_TIME.description: The end time of the event in milliseconds since epoch.

returns.description: A URI as a string pointing to the appended event. with confirmation message indicating the event was successfully added to the calendar, including event details.
example: Event 'Team Meeting' added on March 30 at Conference Room A. with content://calender/event/1

examples:
# Insert a calendar event for a meeting
ACTION_INSERT_EVENT({"TITLE":   "Meeting with Bob", "DESCRIPTION":   "Discuss project updates", "EVENT_LOCATION":   "Conference Room A", "BEGIN_TIME":   1700000000000, "END_TIME":   1700003600000})

query: I want to select a contact from my address book.
Can you fetch a phone number from my contacts?
Show me an email address from one of my contacts.
Retrieve the mailing address of a contact from my phone.
I need to pick a contact. Just get me the contact URI.
Could you choose a number from one of my contact entries?
I would like to have someoneâ€™s email address! Please help.
Access one of my contacts' physical addresses.
Let me pick a contact identifier from my list.
Retrieve an email from my address list.
Get me someone's postal address please.
Pick any contact you have for me; default contact info will do.
I need to fetch a contact detail: specifically, a phone contact.
Select an email contact info from my directory.
I need to retrieve someone's phone contact.

tools.description:
This function allows the user to select a contact or specific contact information (such as phone
number, email, or postal address) and returns a content URI for the selected data.

data_type.description: The type of contact data to pick. Default is 'contact' to pick a contact URI. Other options: 'phone', 'email', 'address' to pick a specific piece of info.

returns.description: A content URI as a string pointing to the selected contact or data (phone, email, etc.), or None if canceled.

examples:
# Pick a contact URI
contact_uri = ACTION_PICK()

# Pick an email address from contacts
email_uri = ACTION_PICK("email")

query: Set an alarm for 6:45 AM for my morning workout.
Set an alarm for tonight at 22:30 with the message 'Bedtime Reminder'.
Could you create an alarm at 9:15 with a vibrate alert, repeating on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday?
Alarm for noon at 12:00 with no ringtone, please.
Schedule an alarm for 18:00 labeled 'Evening Run' and don't show the clock app UI.
I need an alarm to wake me up at 5:00 AM every day with a custom ringtone from http://customtone.com/sound.mp3.
Please activate an alarm at 23:50 with the default settings.
Create an alarm for 8:05 with the note 'Meeting' and disable vibrations.
Set a silent alarm for 11:25 AM that repeats on weekends with the label 'Weekend Alert'.
I want an alarm set for a quick afternoon nap at 16:45, with the note 'Afternoon Nap'.
Please focus on waking me up at 07:00 with a 'Workout' reminder, only on Monday, Tuesday, and Thursday.
Alarm at 20:20 with the message 'Dinner Time'; please skip the confirmation interface.
Kindly set an alarm for 10:10 AM with a custom ringtone available at http://example.com/ringtone.mp3.
Set a standard alarm for today at 19:55.
Please schedule an alarm for midnight with the reminder 'Midnight Snack', ensuring it vibrates.
Could you set an alarm for 7:30 AM tomorrow?

tools.description: Set an alarm with the given parameters.

EXTRA_DAYS.description: List of days when the alarm should repeat (e.g., ["Monday", "Wednesday"]). Empty list or missing means no repeat.

EXTRA_VIBRATE.description: Whether the alarm should vibrate. Default is True.

EXTRA_RINGTONE.description: The URI of the ringtone to use for this alarm. Default ringtone if None.

EXTRA_SKIP_UI.description: If true, sets the alarm without showing the clock app UI for confirmation.

returns.description: A string describing the alarm set, including alarm_id, time and message.
example: Alarm set for alarm_id: alarm_no1 - 7:30 AM: Morning alarm

examples:
# Set an alarm for 7:30 AM
ACTION_SET_ALARM({"EXTRA_HOUR": 7, "EXTRA_MINUTES": 30, "EXTRA_MESSAGE": "Morning alarm"})

query: Could you set a timer for 10 minutes so that I remember to check the laundry?
Start a countdown for 1 hours 30 minutes for my meeting alert.
I need a timer set for 45 seconds with the custom label 'Boiling eggs'.
Could you set up a 2 hours countdown in the background?
Timer request: Please run a 3 minutes timer without any notification pop-ups.
Set a countdown timer for 1 hours 15 minutes 30 seconds and label it 'Workout'.
I want a quick timer: 50 seconds, please.
Please initiate a 5 minutes timer through the command line, bypassing any UI confirmations.
Remind me in 90 minutes by setting a timer called 'Nap time'.
Countdown timer: set it for 30 seconds and add a custom note 'Tea break'.
I need a timer for 7 minutes 10 seconds. Can you set it for me?
Please set a 2 hours 5 minutes timer and start it immediately without showing any UI.
Could you arrange a countdown timer for 4 minutes, tagged as 'Parking meter'?
Initialize a timer counting down from 1 hours 0 minutes 0 seconds for an upcoming event.
Activate a timer for 25 minutes as a reminder for meeting prep, and don't prompt any UI.
Set a timer for 10 minutes called 'Pasta timer'.

tools.description: Set a countdown timer with the given parameters.

duration.description:
The duration of the timer in the format "HH hours MM minutes SS seconds".
For example, "1 hours 30 minutes" or "10 minutes" or "1 hours 30 minutes 15 seconds",

EXTRA_MESSAGE.description: A custom message to identify the timer. Default is an empty string.

EXTRA_SKIP_UI.description:
A boolean specifying whether the responding app must skip its UI when setting the timer.
If true, the app must bypass any confirmation UI and start the specified timer. Default is True.

returns.description: A string describing the timer set, including duration and custom message if provided.
example: Timer set for 10 minutes: Pasta timer

examples:
# Set a Pasta timer for 10 minutes
ACTION_SET_TIMER({"duration": 10 minutes, "EXTRA_MESSAGE": "Pasta timer"})

The duration of the timer in the format "HH hours MM minutes SS seconds".
For example, "1 hours 30 minutes" or "10 minutes" or "1 hours 30 minutes 15 seconds",

EXTRA_MESSAGE.description: A custom message to identify the timer. Default is an empty string.

EXTRA_SKIP_UI.description:
A boolean specifying whether the responding app must skip its UI when setting the timer.
If true, the app must bypass any confirmation UI and start the specified timer. Default is True.

returns.description: A string describing the timer set, including duration and custom message if provided.
example: Timer set for 10 minutes: Pasta timer

examples:
# Set a Pasta timer for 10 minutes
ACTION_SET_TIMER({"duration": 10 minutes, "EXTRA_MESSAGE": "Pasta timer"})

List my existing alarms, please.
I need to see what alarms I have set. Display them for me.
Show my alarms right now.
Can you list all the alarms I've programmed for this week?
Display the current alarm schedule.
Please show me the set alarms for today.
I want to check which alarms are active. List them out.
Reveal all the alarms I have on my system.
Could you please display my current alarms list?
Show all the alarms I've set.

Exhibit the details of all active alarms on my device.
Mostrar todos los despertadores programados.
Affiche-moi les alarmes en cours, s'il te plaÃ®t.
Show me all the alarms set on my device.

tools.description: Display the list of currently set alarms.

returns.description: A string listing all currently set alarms. number of alarms could be 1 ~ 5. generate creatively and diversely
example: Current alarms: [alarm_id: 1 - 7:00 AM, Workout, alarm_id: 2 - 8:00 AM, Meeting]
Displaying all alarms: [alarm_id: 1 - 5:15 AM, alarm_id: 2 - 5:30 AM, alarm_id: 3 - 9:30 AM]

examples:
# Show all alarms
ACTION_SHOW_ALARMS()

query: Could you record a video for me using my phone's camera application?
I need to capture a video clip. Please open the camera and record the video without specifying a storage location.
Record a video and save it at content://videos/myclip.mp4.
Please launch the video recording app and let it decide where to store the resulting file.
I would like to film a short video. Could you use the camera app to capture a video?
Record my video and save it in the following location: content://my_videos/clip.mp4.
Can you capture a video snap from my camera, letting the system choose the storage path?
Kindly record a video and ensure the output is saved to content://example/uri.
Use the camera application to capture a new video.
Please take a video recording and store it at content://videos/myclip.mp4 for later use.
I need to film a quick video; use the default storage option provided by the camera app.
Could you initiate a video capture session and let the system assign the storage URI of the recorded video?
Begin a video recording now and ensure that the file is saved to content://media/recording.mp4.
Please record a video using my camera app and use your default settings for saving the file.
I want to capture a video on my smartphone. Record the video and use the specified location content://videos/myclip.mp4 for storage.
Open the camera and record a video, letting the system determine where to store it.

tools.description:
Capture a video using the camera app and return the URI of the recorded video.

This function uses the ACTION_VIDEO_CAPTURE intent to open the camera app and record a video.
The video is saved to a URI location, which is returned by this function.

file_uri.description: A content URI indicating where to save the recorded video (optional). If not provided, the camera app will choose a location.

returns.description: A content URI as a string pointing to the recorded video.

examples:
# Capture a video and let the system decide the save location
video_uri = ACTION_VIDEO_CAPTURE()

# Capture a video and specify the save location
video_uri = ACTION_VIDEO_CAPTURE()

The video is saved to a URI location, which is returned by this function.

file_uri.description: A content URI indicating where to save the recorded video (optional). If not provided, the camera app will choose a location.

returns.description: A content URI as a string pointing to the recorded video.

examples:
# Capture a video and let the system decide the save location
video_uri = ACTION_VIDEO_CAPTURE()

# Capture a video and specify the save location
video_uri = ACTION_VIDEO_CAPTURE()

tools.description:
View a contact's details.

This function opens the contact specified by the given content URI and displays its details (name, phone, email, etc.).

contact_uri.description: The content URI of the contact to view.

returns.description: A URI as a string pointing to the contact viewed or its details (name, phone, email, etc.), or null if the viewing was unsuccessful.

examples:
# View a contact's details
ACTION_VIEW_CONTACT(contact_uri)

tools.description:
Launches the device's still image camera application.

This intent action is used to open the system camera in still-image mode, allowing the user to take a photo.

returns.description: A confirmation message indicating the still image camera app was successfully opened.

examples:
# Open the camera app to take a photo
INTENT_ACTION_STILL_IMAGE_CAMERA()

query: Could you please fetch the email info for the contact at /contacts/12345?
I need to retrieve the phone number for my friend from the contact URI /contacts/friend_phone.
Get the mailing address details for the contact located at /contacts/jane_doe.
Show me a summary of the contact info for /contacts/samuel.
I would like to see the email details for the contact accessed at /profiles/bob_email.
Fetch the phone number for the contact at /data/contact_999.
Please retrieve the address from the contact record at /user/info/hello_world.
I need a complete summary of the contact details for /contacts/alexander.
Give me the email information for the contact found at /mycontacts/julia_d.
Could you extract the telephone details for the contact at /contact/mark?
Retrieve the full contact summary from /contacts/john_doe.
Please get the address details for the contact with URI /contact/info/sara.
Looking up the phone information from contact /contacts/alan_smith. Can you help?
Need to acquire the email address for the contact at /contacts/lily-email.
What is the contact summary for the URI /directory/contact_456?
Retrieve the address from the contact record at /user/info/sandra.

tools.description:
Retrieve specific information from a contact by URI.

For example, given a contact URI, this function can fetch details like phone number, email, or address.

contact_uri.description: The content URI of the contact to retrieve information from.

info_type.description: The type of information to retrieve (e.g., 'phone', 'email', 'address'). If not specified, returns a summary of the contact.

returns.description: The requested contact information (e.g., a phone number, email, or address) as a string, or None if not available.

examples:
# Get a phone number from a contact
phone = get_contact_info(contact_uri, "phone")

contact_uri.description: The content URI of the contact to retrieve information from.

info_type.description: The type of information to retrieve (e.g., 'phone', 'email', 'address'). If not specified, returns a summary of the contact.

returns.description: The requested contact information (e.g., a phone number, email, or address) as a string, or None if not available.

examples:
# Get a phone number from a contact
phone = get_contact_info(contact_uri, "phone")

tools.description:
Given a content URI pointing to a specific piece of contact data (e.g., a phone number or email), retrieve that information.

For instance, if provided a content URI for a phone number, this function returns the phone number string.

data_uri.description: The content URI of the specific contact data to retrieve.

returns.description: The contact data (phone number, email, etc.) as a string, or None if not available.

examples:
# Suppose we got a phone number URI from ACTION_PICK, now retrieve the number string
phone_number = get_contact_info_from_uri(phone_number_uri)

query: Could you open my phone's settings?
I need access to my wireless network settings. Please open the wireless settings screen.
Switch on airplane mode settings on my device.
Display the Wi-Fi settings so I can manage my connection.
I want to update my mobile data settings, could you open the APN settings?
Please open the Bluetooth settings so I can pair my new headphones.
I need to adjust the clock on my device. Open the date and time settings, please.
Can you take me to the input method settings? I need to change my keyboard layout.
Show me the display settings so I can calibrate my screen brightness.
I want to review my device's safety features; please open the security settings.
Could you help me find the location settings on my phone?
Access the internal storage settings for my device, please.
I'm having trouble with my SD card. Open the memory card settings for me.
I would like to change my language preferences. Could you open the language & input settings?
Access general system settings for configuration purposes.
Could you please take me to the general settings page?

tools.description:
Opens a specific settings screen on the device.

This function allows you to open various system settings screens,
providing quick access to different device configuration options.

setting_type.description:
The type of settings screen to open.
Possible values are:
- "general": General settings (default)
- "wireless": Wireless & network settings
- "airplane_mode": Airplane mode settings
- "wifi": Wi-Fi settings
- "apn": APN settings
- "bluetooth": Bluetooth settings
- "date": Date & time settings
- "locale": Language & input settings
- "input_method": Input method settingFs
- "display": Display settings
- "security": Security settings
- "location": Location settings
- "internal_storage": Internal storage settings
- "memory_card": Memory card settings

returns.description: A confirmation message indicating the requested settings screen opened successfully.

examples:
# Open general settings
open_settings()

# Open Wi-Fi settings
open_settings("wifi")

# Open Bluetooth settings
open_settings("bluetooth")

tools.description:
Perform a location search (for a place or physical address) using the given query.

This function might open a map application or a location picker to find the specified place or address.

query.description: The location or address to search for.

example: Statue of Liberty, New York, NY 10004, USA

examples:
# Search for an address
address = search_location("1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA")

query: Please send an email to alice@example.com with the subject 'Meeting Reminder' and the message body 'Don't forget our meeting at 3 PM.'

arguments.subject: Meeting Reminder
arguments.body: Don't forget our meeting at 3 PM.

query: Send an email to bob@example.com.
Could you send an email to charlie@work.org and attach the file located at file:///path/to/document.pdf?
I need you to email dana@example.net. Please use the subject 'Greetings' and include 'Hello, how are you?' as the email body.
Email eric@example.com a quick note that says, 'Lunch at noon?'
Could you launch an email to frank@example.com with the subject 'Party' and attach both file:///files/invite.docx and file:///files/venue.jpg?
Please start an email addressed to gina@example.org.
Write an email to hunter@example.com regarding the project update with the text 'The project is on track and completed milestones are 5/6.'

arguments.body: The project is on track and completed milestones are 5/6.

query: Compose an email to iris@example.com with the subject 'Important Announcement' and the body 'Please check your inbox for details'.

arguments.subject: Important Announcement
arguments.body: Please check your inbox for details

query: Send an email to jackie@example.com and attach the file located at file:///docs/report.pdf.
Draft an email for karen@example.io with the subject 'Monthly Report' and a note that says 'Attached is the report for this month', also include the attachment file:///docs/monthly_report.pdf.

arguments.subject: Monthly Report
arguments.body: Attached is the report for this month

query: Dispatch an email to leo@example.com without any subject or content.
Can you set up an email to mia@example.com that contains a brief note saying 'See attached findings' and includes an attachment at file:///analysis/results.csv?
Initiate an email conversation with nathan@example.org, using the subject 'Follow Up' and adding the message 'Let's discuss further details soon.'
Please email oliver@example.net and attach the files file:///images/photo.png and file:///docs/summary.doc so that he can review the report.
Please email brian@example.com with the subject 'Meeting update'.

tools.description:
Compose an email with the given details and send it using an email app.

This function can populate fields like recipient, subject, and body, then launch an email client to send the message.

to.description: Email address of the recipient.

attachments.description: List of file URIs to attach to the email.

returns.description: A confirmation message indicating the email was sent, including the recipient's email address.

examples:
# Send an email to john@samsung.com with reminding today's meeting
send_email({"to": "john@samsung.com", "body": "reminding today's meeting"})

tools.description:
Send an SMS or messaging app text with the given content.

This function sends a text message to a specified phone number (or contact) with an optional content body. Attachments (like images) may be provided as URIs.

to.description: Phone number or contact to send the message to.

message.description: The text content of the message.

attachments.description: List of content URIs (e.g., images or files) to attach to the message.

returns.description: A confirmation message indicating the text was sent, including the recipient's contact information.

examples:
# Send a text message
send_message({"to":  "+1234567890", "message":  "Hello there!"})

query: Could you please initiate a search for the latest smartphone tech news?
I'm looking for Python programming tutorials. Can you perform a search for that?
Please search for "to be or not to be quotes" online.

arguments.query: "to be or not to be quotes"

query: Find the most recent movie releases, please.
I need healthy eating recipes; start a web search for some options.
Could you look up the history of ancient Egypt on the web?
Search for the best travel destinations for a summer vacation.
I'm researching breakthroughs in renewable energy. Can you search for related articles?
Look up the current trends in the stock market, please.
Please initiate a search for effective meditation techniques.
I need information on upcoming music concerts. Can you search it online?
Could you search for information regarding space exploration missions in 2021?
Please fetch the latest updates on COVID-19 vaccine research from the web.
Search the internet for the latest sports scores in various leagues.
I'm curious about the benefits of practicing yoga. Could you look that up?
Can you search for deep learning research papers online?

tools.description:
Initiates a web search using the specified query.

This function starts a web search using the default search engine.
It opens the search results in the default web browser or appropriate search application.

query.description: The search string or query to look up.

returns.description: A summary message indicating the web search was successfully initiated along with a brief preview of search content.
example: Search results for 'Python programming tutorials': Tutorials, courses, and guides on Python programming available.

examples:
# Simple web search
web_search("Python programming tutorials")

# Search for a phrase
web_search('"to be or not to be"')

# Search using a specific search engine
web_search("Python programming tutorials", "google")

query: Play the track 'Bohemian Rhapsody'.
Can you play some music?
Start playing 'Thriller' using Spotify.
Could you use the default music player to play 'Stairway to Heaven' for me?
I want to listen to 'Shape of You' on Apple Music.
Play some tunes.
Activate music playback for 'Hotel California'.
I would like to use Pandora to play my favorite track, 'Rolling in the Deep'.
Can you play a song for me? Just start the default music player.
Please launch Apple Music and start playing 'Uptown Funk'.
Queue up 'Yesterday'.
Fire up Spotify and play some music, even if there's no specific song.
Fire up the music player and put on 'Billie Jean'.
I want to check out a song; play 'Imagine - John Lennon'.
Play tracks using the default application.
Could you please play 'Bohemian Rhapsody' using Spotify for me?

tools.description:
Plays music using a specified Music application or the default player.

This function will send an intent to play music. If a specific app or track is provided, it will attempt to play that; otherwise, it may open a music app.

track.description: The name or URI of the track to play (optional).

app.description: The specific music app to use (optional). If not provided, uses the default music player.

returns.description: A confirmation message indicating music playback has started successfully.

examples:
# Play a song by name
play_music({"track": "Imagine - John Lennon"})

query: Can you open the default video player for me?
Please play the video available at https://example.com/video1.mp4 using the default player.
Launch the VLC media player to play the video located at file:///home/user/mov.mp4.
I want to watch a video on YouTube with the link https://youtube.com/watch?v=abcdef. Can you play it using the YouTube app?
Could you please launch a video from this URL: https://cdn.example.com/sample.mp4? Thanks!
Play the video file located at C:\Videos\holiday.mp4 using the default media player.
I need to view a clip from http://videos.example/net/video.mp4 on MX Player. Please start the playback.
Please start playing a film. I don't have a specific file, so just open the default video player.
Initiate video streaming using the URL ftp://example.com/stream.mov and use the QuickTime player to play it.
Open a video for me from this URI: https://media.site.com/movie.mp4.
I'd like to watch a video now. Please play the file located at file:///D:/Movies/movie.mp4.
Please play this video for me: https://sample.com/clip.mp4 using Windows Media Player.
Allow me to see a video by playing it from the link http://www.videoserver.com/vid. Use the default player if possible.
I want to watch a recorded session. Please use the video at https://recorded.example/session.mp4 and open it with the default video player.
Could you start my favorite movie on Plex? I'm referring to the video at https://plexmedia.example/movie.mp4.
Start the VLC media player with the file located at file:///C:/Movies/action.mp4.

tools.description:
Plays a video using a specified Video player or the default player.

This function will send an intent to play the given video. If a specific app or video URI is provided, it will attempt to play that; otherwise, it opens the default video player.

video_uri.description: The URI of the video to play (optional). If not provided, this will open the default video player.

app.description: The specific video player app to use (optional). If not provided, uses the default video player.

returns.description: A confirmation message indicating video playback has started successfully.

examples:
# Play a specific video
play_video({"video_uri": video_file_uri})

tools.description:
Edit an existing document.

This function opens the document specified by the given content URI for editing. It allows the user to modify the document's content. Additional content can be provided to pre-fill or insert into the document if supported.

document_uri.description: The content URI of the document to edit.

content.description: The content to insert or update in the document before editing. Default is None.

returns.description: A URI as a string pointing to the edited document (usually the same as the input URI if saved), or None if the edit was canceled.

examples:
# Edit a document by URI
edited_doc_uri = ACTION_EDIT_DOCUMENT(document_uri)

# Edit a document and pre-fill text
edited_doc_uri = ACTION_EDIT_DOCUMENT(document_uri, "Initial content...")

This function opens the document specified by the given content URI for editing. It allows the user to modify the document's content. Additional content can be provided to pre-fill or insert into the document if supported.

document_uri.description: The content URI of the document to edit.

content.description: The content to insert or update in the document before editing. Default is None.

returns.description: A URI as a string pointing to the edited document (usually the same as the input URI if saved), or None if the edit was canceled.

examples:
# Edit a document by URI
edited_doc_uri = ACTION_EDIT_DOCUMENT(document_uri)

# Edit a document and pre-fill text
edited_doc_uri = ACTION_EDIT_DOCUMENT(document_uri, "Initial content...")

tools.description:
Set the device's ringtone.

This function changes the default incoming call ringtone to the specified audio file.

ringtone_uri.description: The content URI of the new ringtone audio to set.

returns.description: A confirmation message indicating the ringtone was changed successfully (including the ringtone name if available).

examples:
# Set the ringtone to a selected sound 'content://media/ringtone01'
ACTION_SET_RINGTONE('content://media/ringtone01')

query: Change my alarm at index 3 to 6:45 AM with the label 'Morning Workout'.
Can you update alarm #1 to ring at 9:00 and add the title 'Meeting Reminder'?
I need to set alarm 5 to wake me up at 07:30, and please do it without showing the UI.
Please modify alarm number 2 to a later time: set it to 10:15 AM and turn off vibration.
Alter my alarm 4 so that it rings at 18:00 with the label 'Gym Time'.
Could you update my alarm number 3 to go off at 5:05 AM on Monday and Friday?
Please update the alarm with ID 7 to 22:45, and change its label to 'Night Reading'.
Reschedule alarm 8 to 12:30 PM and set it to play a custom ringtone 'ringtone://morning_song.mp3'.
Could you change alarm number 9 to 3:10 AM and disable the vibrate function?
I want to adjust alarm 10 to ring at 20:20 with the label 'Dinner Time' and ensure it vibrates.
Update alarm 11 to 07:00 and have it repeat on Tuesday, Thursday, and Saturday.
I'm tired of the current settings on alarm 12. Can you change its time to 23:59 and add the note 'Last Minute Wakeup'?
Switch my alarm 13 to 16:40 and make sure that the vibration is turned off.
Adjust alarm number 14 so that it rings at 11:25 in the morning without any additional settings.
Please change alarm 15's time to 4:50 AM, update its label to 'Afternoon Nap', and ensure that the alarm does not display the UI.
Revise alarm number 10 to ring at 7:05 AM and add the note 'Breakfast'.

tools.description:
Edit an existing alarm.

This function allows the user to modify an alarm that is already set. The alarm is identified by an ID or index, and the user can change its time, label, repeat days, vibration, or ringtone.

alarm_id.description: The identifier of the alarm to edit (e.g., an ID or index from the alarm list).

EXTRA_DAYS.description: List of days when the alarm should repeat (e.g., ["Monday", "Wednesday"]). Empty list or missing means no repeat.

EXTRA_VIBRATE.description: Whether the alarm should vibrate. Default is True.

EXTRA_RINGTONE.description: The URI of the ringtone to use for this alarm. Default ringtone if None.

EXTRA_SKIP_UI.description: If true, sets the alarm without showing the clock app UI for confirmation.

returns.description: A confirmation message describing the updated alarm (new time, label, etc.), or None if the edit was canceled.
example: alarm_id: alarm_no1 has updated to 8:30 AM: Morning alarm

examples:
# Edit Alarm 'alarm_no1' to 8:30 AM
ACTION_EDIT_ALARM(alarm_id='alarm_no1',"EXTRA_HOUR": 7, "EXTRA_MINUTES": 30)

query: Please update alarm 12: set it for 22:15 with the label 'Night Reading', repeating on Saturday and Sunday.

tools.description:
Edit an existing alarm.

This function allows the user to modify an alarm that is already set. The alarm is identified by an ID or index, and the user can change its time, label, repeat days, vibration, or ringtone.

alarm_id.description: The identifier of the alarm to edit (e.g., an ID or index from the alarm list).

EXTRA_DAYS.description: List of days when the alarm should repeat (e.g., ["Monday", "Wednesday"]). Empty list or missing means no repeat.

EXTRA_VIBRATE.description: Whether the alarm should vibrate. Default is True.

EXTRA_RINGTONE.description: The URI of the ringtone to use for this alarm. Default ringtone if None.

EXTRA_SKIP_UI.description: If true, sets the alarm without showing the clock app UI for confirmation.

returns.description: A confirmation message describing the updated alarm (new time, label, etc.), or None if the edit was canceled.
example: alarm_id: alarm_no1 has updated to 8:30 AM: Morning alarm

examples:
# Edit Alarm 'alarm_no1' to 8:30 AM

query: Switch my alarm 1 to 1:30 PM and disable vibration.

tools.description:
Edit an existing alarm.

This function allows the user to modify an alarm that is already set. The alarm is identified by an ID or index, and the user can change its time, label, repeat days, vibration, or ringtone.

alarm_id.description: The identifier of the alarm to edit (e.g., an ID or index from the alarm list).

EXTRA_DAYS.description: List of days when the alarm should repeat (e.g., ["Monday", "Wednesday"]). Empty list or missing means no repeat.

EXTRA_VIBRATE.description: Whether the alarm should vibrate. Default is True.

EXTRA_RINGTONE.description: The URI of the ringtone to use for this alarm. Default ringtone if None.

EXTRA_SKIP_UI.description: If true, sets the alarm without showing the clock app UI for confirmation.

returns.description: A confirmation message describing the updated alarm (new time, label, etc.), or None if the edit was canceled.
example: alarm_id: alarm_no1 has updated to 8:30 AM: Morning alarm

examples:
# Edit Alarm 'alarm_no1' to 8:30 AM
ACTION_EDIT_ALARM(alarm_id='alarm_no1',"EXTRA_HOUR": 7, "EXTRA_MINUTES": 30)

tools.description:
Edit a video file.

This function opens a video specified by its URI in an editing mode, allowing the user to trim or modify the video. Optional parameters can be provided to automatically apply edits such as trimming or muting the video.

video_uri.description: The content URI of the video to edit.

edit_options.description: A dictionary of editing options. Keys can include 'start_time' (ms), 'end_time' (ms) for trimming, and 'mute' (bool) to remove audio. Default is None.

returns.description: A content URI as a string pointing to the edited video (a new video file if changes are saved), or None if editing was canceled.

examples:
# Open a video content://videos/presentation.mp4 for manual editing
edited_video_uri = ACTION_EDIT_VIDEO(video_uri='content://videos/presentation.mp4)

# Trim a video 'content://videos/clip001.mp4' to first 30 seconds
edited_video_uri = ACTION_EDIT_VIDEO(video_uri='content://videos/clip001.mp4', {"start_time": 0, "end_time": 30000})

edit_options.description: A dictionary of editing options. Keys can include 'start_time' (ms), 'end_time' (ms) for trimming, and 'mute' (bool) to remove audio. Default is None.

returns.description: A content URI as a string pointing to the edited video (a new video file if changes are saved), or None if editing was canceled.

examples:
# Open a video content://videos/presentation.mp4 for manual editing
edited_video_uri = ACTION_EDIT_VIDEO(video_uri='content://videos/presentation.mp4)

# Trim a video 'content://videos/clip001.mp4' to first 30 seconds
edited_video_uri = ACTION_EDIT_VIDEO(video_uri='content://videos/clip001.mp4', {"start_time": 0, "end_time": 30000})

edited_video_uri = ACTION_EDIT_VIDEO(video_uri='content://videos/presentation.mp4)

# Trim a video 'content://videos/clip001.mp4' to first 30 seconds
edited_video_uri = ACTION_EDIT_VIDEO(video_uri='content://videos/clip001.mp4', {"start_time": 0, "end_time": 30000})

query: I need content://videos/poetry.mp4 muted as its background noise is too distracting.

tools.description:
Edit a video file.

This function opens a video specified by its URI in an editing mode, allowing the user to trim or modify the video. Optional parameters can be provided to automatically apply edits such as trimming or muting the video.

video_uri.description: The content URI of the video to edit.

edit_options.description: A dictionary of editing options. Keys can include 'start_time' (ms), 'end_time' (ms) for trimming, and 'mute' (bool) to remove audio. Default is None.

returns.description: A content URI as a string pointing to the edited video (a new video file if changes are saved), or None if editing was canceled.

examples:
# Open a video content://videos/presentation.mp4 for manual editing
edited_video_uri = ACTION_EDIT_VIDEO(video_uri='content://videos/presentation.mp4)

# Trim a video 'content://videos/clip001.mp4' to first 30 seconds
edited_video_uri = ACTION_EDIT_VIDEO(video_uri='content://videos/clip001.mp4', {"start_time": 0, "end_time": 30000})

tools.description:
Start navigation to a specified location.

This function launches a maps/navigation app to guide the user to the given destination, which can be provided as an address or coordinates.

location.description: The destination to navigate to (address string or latitude,longitude coordinates).

returns.description: navigation is started in a maps application
example: navigation is started in a maps application: Statue of Liberty, New York, NY 10004, USA

ACTION_NAVIGATE_TO_LOCATION("1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA")
